posts.post_content: exceedingly strong, particularly with the cipher mechanic. I actually just put him out late game after milling half of their library with [Traumatize](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Traumatize) or whatever and then use a [Rogue's Passage](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Rogue's Passage) to swing for all their life. If nothing else, he is a five cost that should be exceedingly big when you play him and can block most fatties with favorable results. I would love to use this in a deck with [Tamiyo](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Tamiyo) and some cheap spell I could keep re-casting until they had nothing left to mill.

posts.post_content: Combos very well with cipher. Cipher casts the spell again, which triggers the ability. Pair this with [Talrand, Sky Summoner](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Talrand, Sky Summoner), [Sage's Row Denizen](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Sage's Row Denizen), and [Undercity Informer](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Undercity Informer) for some serious mill power. Perhaps you could throw on [Riot Gear](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Riot Gear) to prevent unexpected death of your biggest creature.

Posted By: Evilsqirrel (2/17/2013 2:50:59 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
Not sure if anybody caught onto this, but I noticed a card that combos very neatly with this guy. [Essence Harvest](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Essence Harvest) will force a mill before it resolves, meaning that Consuming Aberration actually grows prior to determining what the value of X is. If you set up the graveyard earlier for the Aberration to be exceptionally large, you could potentially end the game on the spot.  
  
Warning: Above listed strategy is prone to cards such as [Tormod's Crypt](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Tormod's Crypt).
posts.html:

Posted By: 2-Bravo (2/14/2013 11:33:05 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
I love this flavor of mill so much. Sure, it's less reliable than "mill x" or whatever, but it's so much fun watching an opponent sweat as they mill an indeterminate number of cards, and there's always the chance that they'll rip off like seven or eight cards.   
  
[Mind Funeral](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Mind Funeral) has already been mentioned. Splash white in your mill deck, and you can be even more of a jerk and include a playset of [Path to Exile](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Path to Exile) to help get that land count down. And don't forget [Ghost Quarter](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Ghost Quarter).
posts.html:
I love this flavor of mill so much. Sure, it's less reliable than "mill x" or whatever, but it's so much fun watching an opponent sweat as they mill an indeterminate number of cards, and there's always the chance that they'll rip off like seven or eight cards.

Mind Funeral has already been mentioned. Splash white in your mill deck, and you can be even more of a jerk and include a playset of Path to Exile to help get that land count down. And don't forget Ghost Quarter.
